title: HMPV virus cases LIVE: 3 cases in India; Karnataka issues advisory titled ‘Do Not Panic’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
HMPV Virus Cases LIVE: 3 cases in India; Karnataka issues advisory titled ‘Do Not Panic’

Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

India has confirmed its first three cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), prompting health officials to reassure the public that the virus is akin to regular flu and not a new threat.

  • Three cases of HMPV have been confirmed in India: two in Karnataka and one in Gujarat, all in children.
  • Health officials emphasize that HMPV is not a new pathogen, and flu and Covid vaccinations provide immunity.
  • The Karnataka government has issued an advisory titled 'Do Not Panic, Be Aware'.
  • Symptoms resemble those of the common cold, with serious cases leading to bronchitis or pneumonia.
  • Experts highlight the importance of routine surveillance and public awareness about HMPV.
“HMPV is an existing flu virus causing respiratory issues and is not a cause for panic,” said Karnataka Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao.

This outbreak underscores the need for vigilance and proper health measures as health authorities monitor and respond to HMPV cases.
newTitle: HMPV Virus Cases in India: Advisory Issued to Remain Calm

title: BJP's ‘Advertisement Baba’ jibe at Arvind Kejriwal: ‘Such a big scam for Sheesh Mahal’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP Criticizes Kejriwal Over Sheesh Mahal Renovation Costs

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The BJP has labeled Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal as “Advertisement Baba” amidst allegations regarding the expensive renovations of his residence, the 'Sheesh Mahal', detailed in a report by the CAG.

  • The total cost of the Delhi CM residence renovation was ₹33.66 crore.
  • BJP MP Sambit Patra highlighted that the promotion cost for the 'Business Blasters' scheme was ₹80 crore, which was significantly higher than the scheme budget of ₹54 crore.
  • CAG reported that tender costs rose 342.31% above initial estimates.
  • The construction and remodeling were completed in 2022.
“Such a big scam was committed for Arvind Kejriwal's 'Sheesh Mahal'... The CAG raised questions on the tendering process.” - Sambit Patra

The controversy underscores the economic implications of public works during the pandemic, questioning priorities in governance.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Kejriwal Over Sheesh Mahal Renovation Costs

title: Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As Cases Rise - NDTV
summary:
Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As Cases Rise

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Union Health Ministry

The article reports the first confirmed cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in India, with cases in Bengaluru and Ahmedabad. The Union health ministry is proactively monitoring the situation.

  • Three cases of HMPV confirmed in India.
  • Affected infants are from Bengaluru and Ahmedabad, with no recent travel history.
  • Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Delhi governments have issued preparedness guidelines.
  • HMPV is a respiratory virus recognized worldwide, particularly affecting young children and those with weakened immune systems.
“The Indian Council of Medical Research (IMCR) will continue to track trends in HMPV circulation throughout the year.”

The emergence of HMPV cases underscores the need for vigilant health measures and monitoring.
newTitle: Guidelines Issued as First HMPV Cases Confirmed in India

title: Eight jawans of District Reserve Guards killed after Naxals blow up vehicle in Chhattisgarh - The Hindu
Chhattisgarh: Naxals blow up vehicle of security personnel in Bijapur, 8 DRG jawans dead - Hindustan Times
summary:
Naxal Attack in Chhattisgarh Claims Lives of 8 Security Personnel

Publication Date: January 06, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

In a tragic incident, eight District Reserve Guard (DRG) jawans and one driver were killed in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh, when their vehicle was targeted by Naxals using an improvised explosive device (IED).

  • The blast occurred on the Bedre-Kutru Road.
  • This marks the largest loss of life among security forces due to Naxalite violence in two years.
  • The attack occurred during the return of DRG personnel from a joint operation involving multiple districts.
  • Deputy Chief Minister Arun Sao condemned the attack, promising efforts to eliminate Naxalism by 2026.
  • The incident coincided with a report of Naxal casualties in a separate encounter in the Bastar region.
“The sacrifice of the soldiers won’t go to waste,” said Deputy CM Arun Sao.

This incident underscores the ongoing conflict and challenges faced by security forces in combating Naxalite insurgency in the region.
newTitle: Naxal Attack in Chhattisgarh Claims Lives of 8 Security Personnel

title: ISRO’s SpaDeX docking experiment postponed to January 9 - The Hindu
summary:
ISRO’s SpaDeX Docking Experiment Postponed to January 9

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The docking of the two Space Docking Experiment (SpaDeX) satellites, initially scheduled for January 7, has been postponed to January 9 due to the need for further validation through ground simulations.

  • The ISRO announced the postponement in a social media post.
  • This delay allows for additional checks following an identified abort scenario.
  • The initial docking was expected to occur following the successful launch of the PSLV C60 rocket on December 30, 2024.
  • The docking window remains open until January 10, 2025.
“The SpaDeX Docking scheduled on 7th is now postponed to 9th. Stay tuned for updates,” ISRO stated.

This postponement is not a major concern as the mission maintains a flexible timeline for the docking process.
newTitle: ISRO’s SpaDeX Docking Experiment Postponed to January 9

Ravi left the Assembly without delivering his address due to the anthem not being played. The piece discusses the Raj Bhavan's claims of constitutional disrespect and the Tamil Nadu government's defense which states that the state anthem is traditionally played first.

  • The Tamil Nadu Governor left the Assembly due to the national anthem not being played.
  • The Raj Bhavan claims this is an insult to the Constitution and the anthem.
  • The Tamil Nadu government defends its convention of playing the state anthem first.
  • Different legislative assemblies have varied practices regarding the national anthem.
  • The Constitution mandates respect for the anthem as a fundamental duty.
“Not singing the anthem is a matter of grave concern.”

The ongoing debate highlights the differences in procedural traditions in various assemblies and raises questions about the enforcement of national respect.

title: Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra Issue Guidelines As Cases Rise - NDTV
summary:
Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra Issue Guidelines As Cases Rise

Date: Not specified; Source: Not specified

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is spreading globally, causing health concerns and prompting monitoring in various countries. In India, two cases have been reported in Bengaluru, with health authorities responding accordingly.

  • HMPV has flu-like symptoms and is similar to Covid-19.
  • Two cases reported in Bengaluru; a 3-month-old has been discharged and an 8-month-old is recovering.
  • Neither patient had a history of international travel.
  • Young children, the elderly, and those with weakened immune systems are most vulnerable to HMPV.
  • Health authorities are closely monitoring developments in the context of seasonal respiratory illnesses in China.

title: Nimisha Priya case handled by Houthi militias, death sentence not ratified by President: Yemen Embassy - The Hindu
summary:
Yemen Embassy Clarifies Death Sentence Status for Malayali Nurse Nimisha Priya

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Embassy of Yemen has denied that President Dr. Rashid Al-Alimi ratified the death sentence for Malayali nurse Nimisha Priya, who is currently on death row in Yemen.

  • The Yemeni government states that the case was handled entirely by Houthi militias.
  • Nimisha Priya was sentenced to death by a trial court in Sanaa for the alleged murder of a Yemeni national in July 2017.
  • Her appeal was dismissed by Yemen’s Supreme Judicial Council in November 2023.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs of India is providing support to Nimisha Priya's family.
“The Yemeni government emphasizes that the entire case has been handled by the Houthi militias, and therefore, Dr. Rashid Al-Alimi has not ratified this judgment.”

The situation surrounding Nimisha Priya's case remains critical, and the government of India is actively involved in seeking assistance for her.
newTitle: Yemen Embassy Clarifies Death Sentence Status for Malayali Nurse Nimisha Priya

title: Maha Kumbh 2025: World's Largest Gathering Of People - NDTV
Ingredients of suicide abetment made out against Atul Subhash wife: Karnataka High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Karnataka High Court Rejects Quashing Plea in Atul Subhash Suicide Case

Published on: 06 Jan 2025, 6:59 am

The Karnataka High Court ruled against a quashing plea filed by Nikita Singhania, accused of abetting her husband Atul Subhash's suicide, asserting that the FIR holds prima facie evidence of the alleged offence.

  • The High Court deemed that the FIR contained sufficient details to support the abetment of suicide charge.
  • Nikita Singhania claims the FIR lacks evidence for an offence, but the Court disagrees.
  • The FIR was filed following Subhash's suicide, where he left a note blaming Singhania and her family for his death.
  • A social media uproar ensued, leading to an FIR and subsequent arrests of Singhania and her relatives.
  • The case is adjourned pending submission of investigation details by the prosecution.
“My reading of this complaint is that ingredients are made out. And it is not a case of quashing.” – Justice SR Krishna Kumar

The Court's decision highlights the complexity of legal battles intertwined with personal tragedies and the ongoing scrutiny such cases face in public forums.
newTitle: Karnataka High Court Rejects Quashing Plea in Atul Subhash Suicide Case

title: Chandigarh: Old Mehfil Hotel building collapses in Sector 17 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Chandigarh Old Mehfil Hotel Building Collapses: No Casualties Reported

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A major tragedy was averted when the old Mehfil Hotel building in Sector 17 collapsed early on Monday morning. The building was unoccupied at the time of the incident and no injuries have been reported.

  • The building collapsed because three load-bearing pillars were found to be structurally compromised.
  • The area had been evacuated a week prior following the detection of cracks during repair work.
  • Authorities had cordoned off the area to ensure public safety, according to UT senior superintendent of police (SSP) Kanwardeep Kaur.
  • A detailed report on the structural impact will be prepared by the deputy commissioner’s office.
  • This incident follows a recent building collapse in Mohali, which resulted in two fatalities.
newTitle: Chandigarh Old Mehfil Hotel Building Collapses: No Casualties Reported

title: High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’ - The Indian Express
summary:
High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’

Publication Date: Monday

Source: [Your News Source]

On Monday morning, K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samiti, found himself in a standoff with the Telangana Anti Corruption Bureau. He refused to enter the ACB office without his lawyer present, leading to significant drama outside the agency’s premises.

  • KTR stated that the ACB barred his lawyer from attending while his statement was recorded.
  • After 45 minutes in their vehicle, KTR left without giving his statement, having submitted a lawyer's response to the ACB notice.
  • He asserted his right to have legal representation during questioning, citing concerns over trust towards the ACB and past incidents involving other politicians.
  • The ACB had summoned him regarding the Formula E race case, linked to an alleged financial transfer to a foreign company.
  • KTR has challenged the ACB's FIR against him in the High Court, which has yet to issue a ruling.
“I do not trust this government and the police are acting under the instructions of a third-rate criminal like Revanth Reddy,” KTR claimed.

The situation has raised questions about legal rights and procedural integrity as KTR awaits further developments in his case.
newTitle: Standoff at Telangana ACB Office: KTR Questions Legal Proceedings

title: Hotel collapses in Chandigarh’s Sector 17, no injuries reported - The Indian Express
summary:
Hotel Mehfil collapses in Chandigarh’s Sector 17, no injuries reported

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: The Indian Express

A hotel located close to the Deputy Commissioner’s office in Chandigarh’s Sector 17 collapsed early on Monday. The building was declared unsafe and had been evacuated days prior, with no injuries reported.

  • The hotel, named Hotel Mehfil, had been closed for some years.
  • Three pillars of the hotel developed cracks a week ago due to ongoing renovation work.
  • The Chandigarh administration evacuated the building following the detection of the cracks.
  • Area was cordoned off by police as a precaution before the collapse.
  • Chandigarh Deputy Commissioner Nishant Yadav confirmed the evacuation and investigation into the incident.
  • Previously, a building in Mohali collapsed, resulting in fatalities.
“Separately, the estate office has issued a notice to the owner as the revised building plan was not approved and the renovation was being done without nod,” said DC Nishant Yadav.

The hotel, built in the 1960s, was formerly owned by minister Harmohan Dhawan.

The incident highlights ongoing construction safety concerns in the region.
newTitle: Hotel Mehfil Collapses in Chandigarh's Sector 17 Without Injuries

This year’s Maha Kumbh, scheduled from January 13 to February 26 in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, is expected to attract around 400 million devotees over 45 days, providing brands with a unique opportunity to engage with diverse audiences.

  • The event occurs once every 12 years and is a major cultural gathering.
  • Estimated brand expenditure during the festivities is around ₹3,000 crore.
  • Ashish Vohra, CEO of Onora Hospitality, highlights the significance of the event and aims for substantial revenue through religious tourism.
  • Expected revenue for Onora Hospitality is between ₹12-15 crore over two months.
“This Kumbh holds special significance as this particular event occurs once in 144 years.” – Ashish Vohra

The Maha Kumbh 2025 represents a crossroads of cultural tradition and modern branding strategies, emphasizing the importance of religious tourism.

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi walks out of Assembly without reading customary address - The Hindu
summary:
Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi Walks Out of Assembly Session

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi left the Assembly without delivering his customary address due to a conflict regarding the playing of the national anthem.

  • The Governor insisted that the national anthem should be played after the state anthem, which did not happen.
  • Raj Bhavan criticized the Assembly for not respecting the national anthem, describing the incident as an insult to the Constitution.
  • The Governor remained in the House for only three minutes before leaving in protest.
  • After his departure, the main opposition party protested, demanding justice for a recent sexual assault incident at a university.
  • This incident marks the second consecutive Assembly session where the Governor has walked out.
“The Constitution of Bharat and the National Anthem were once again insulted in the Tamil Nadu Assembly today.” - Raj Bhavan Statement

The controversy surrounding the Governor's exit reinforces tensions between state officials and the Governor's office on ceremonial matters.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi Walks Out of Assembly Session

title: Chhattisgarh journalist Mukesh Chandrakar murder case: Main accused Suresh Chandrakar taken into custody by SIT in Hyderabad. - The Hindu
summary:
Chhattisgarh Journalist Murder Case: Main Accused Suresh Chandrakar Arrested

Published: January 06, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The key suspect in the murder of Bastar journalist and YouTuber Mukesh Chandrakar, Suresh Chandrakar, was arrested by a Special Investigation Team (SIT) in Hyderabad on January 5, 2025.

  • Suresh Chandrakar was taken into custody after being on the run since the murder.
  • His siblings, Ritesh and Dinesh Chandrakar, along with a third suspect named Mahendra, were arrested earlier on January 4, 2025.
  • Mukesh Chandrakar, a prominent journalist, was recently involved in uncovering a road construction scam.
  • His body was discovered in a septic tank after being reported missing on New Year’s Day.
“Ritesh was arrested in Raipur, while Dinesh and Mahendra were detained in Bijapur,” said a police officer.

This case highlights the dangers faced by journalists in exposing corruption and criminal activities.
newTitle: Chhattisgarh Journalist Murder Case: Main Accused Suresh Chandrakar Arrested

title: Chhattisgarh journalist murder: Main accused Suresh Chandrakar arrested from Hyderabad - Hindustan Times
Main accused in journalist’s murder in Chhattisgarh arrested from Hyderabad - The Indian Express
summary:
Main accused in Chhattisgarh journalist Mukesh Chandrakar’s murder arrested in Hyderabad

Date: Sunday, Publication Source: The Indian Express

The Chhattisgarh police have arrested Suresh Chandrakar, the alleged main accused in the murder of journalist Mukesh Chandrakar, from Telangana. The arrest comes after a series of detentions related to the case.

  • Suresh was arrested late at night on Sunday.
  • Three others, including Suresh's brothers, were previously arrested in connection to the murder.
  • Mukesh was reportedly murdered due to interference in his cousin's construction work.
  • Authorities demolished illegal property belonging to Suresh following the murder.
  • Mukesh's body was found in a septic tank a day after he was reported missing.
  • Mukesh was a freelancer with connections to prominent media outlets.
“As a journalist, my colleague paid the ultimate price for exposing the truth...” - Anurag Dwary, Resident Editor, NDTV

This incident highlights the dangers journalists face while pursuing accountability in their work. The ongoing investigation aims to ensure justice for Mukesh Chandrakar.
newTitle: Main accused in Chhattisgarh journalist Mukesh Chandrakar’s murder arrested in Hyderabad
